lines.text: And you had to lose that one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, that's right, Doty. You're new. You're new Doty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Doty, don't do that.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Doty, don't do that. Doty, don't play that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a plan. I need to borrow the scrying orb. I'm going to make a list. On a map, I'm going to mark every roadside inn within about 200 miles.

lines.text: Okay. There's a number of inns in the Turst Fields. There's a couple at the Jorenn Village, which you are familiar with. They might be just outside of the range, but you put them on there as well. Westruun, and along the road of the Silver Cut.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What was that thing you said? Turns field?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's the Turst Fields.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And what was the other one?

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. Where's the sun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now? It's close to noon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll finish this and I'll give it a few hours for the sun to go down so that I can actually figure out what direction the inn is facing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I couldn't try and do a nature check to try and figure out what direction the wind was coming from when it hit me during the scry?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Save the sphere. I've got a plan. In the meantime, let's search Hilda's house.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Okay. We go and search Hilda's house.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no response.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does Trinket smell-- We go in-- Wait! Sorry. Check for traps. Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. It is locked, but it does not appear to be trapped.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. It's not locked anymore. 32.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, yeah. It's a simple lock. As you walk inside, you see the candle that was lit the other night has melted entirely and the wax is dripping off the side of the small bench where it was laid on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One more in here. Is there any bullshit hiding around in here? 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 29. There's no bullshit, necessarily, but there is that pile of linens in the corner. You see it shifting slightly, and as you pull off the side you see there, bound, Hilda. She's like, (muffled noises).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, Whisper out, and I cut her free.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You all right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm all right."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What happened?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (stuttering) "Naught but a few days ago, this blue-skinned woman came, and she seemed nice "enough, and she asked me questions. She didn't hurt me or nothing, "she just asked a lot of questions."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And you've met us before? No?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. I've seen you around town. People talk about you, saying what you've "done for the people..."

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you bake cream puffs?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have before, yeah."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, does Trinket smell anything having to do with-- can he smell a different smell? Can he smell the evil Hilda?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check with advantage for Trinket.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's good. That's also pretty good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Perception? That is 24!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Trinket goes, (sniffing, grunting) and picks up what appears to be some sort of a scent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! Where did it go?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not really a bloodhound-style scent, but a decent scent. Guiding him around over the next hour or so, and trying to go in the areas you know he might have been, the last strong scent is in Taryon's room, and there's no trail from there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Motherfucker. This is terrible. I feel like we did this to him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to get him back. Now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's just so vulnerable.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Right. Do I have enough of an angle on the sun now, where this should be doable?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Figure out which way is north, south, east, and west if I try and scry on Tary?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Yeah, you gauge the sun in the sky.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right. Kiki, let's do this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Am I helping you? Are we doing this together?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, you're giving me the orb, since you have the orb.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm giving you the orb.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I'm going to give it back to you when I'm done.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I feel like you did this before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Successfully.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I underestimated you. Do you need my help?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and glean as much information about the nature of the landscape around the person that I'm focusing on as humanly possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I'm going to try and figure out a discerned direction?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Help with type of plants, whether or not it's getting south, east, west. Not north. Most probably south.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, before you do that. You take the orb and sit down and concentrate, and Keyleth aids you in setting up this small ritual. As you close your eyes and focus on Taryon once more, your vision shifts and seem to be jettisoned across hundreds of miles within a second. No direction at the moment; it's too much of a blur of color and light and movement until it comes to a halt, and there you see Taryon, somewhat jostled by the spell kicking in and the momentum, you see him thrown over what appears to be the back of a horse, just (hoofbeats).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Which way is the shadow of the horse?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Taryon, you come to consciousness ever so slightly, and looking down, you see hooves clattering on the ground behind you. You glance around. Percival, I want you to go ahead and make a nature check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on! They're going to Wildmount.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is not my strong suit. That'll do, though! 22.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The air appears cold, as the winter here seems to cling to the countryside for a majority of the year, a mixture of gloom and beauty as unique as it is impressive. That's about as much as you can glean from this standpoint. It's very blurred on the outskirts. It seems similar to a harsher Whitestone landscape. This is definitely further east. Looking at placement of the sun in the sky, it's further to the west.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They've gone east. They're still on the northern end of the continent, if they're on the continent at all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, any further north from here and they'd be in the water. For the time they've traveled, they're east on Wildmount somewhere, you can gather.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: East on Wildmount. Is there any other sign? Can I see a tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Unfortunately, the scrying location, the actual orb that you see from is very limited in scope. The fact that you're able to even make out the details that I told you are because you're seeing color and images and shapes in the distance. You get a vague idea of landscape, but it's all very blurred.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it giving me any sense of anywhere I've been before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you do see, though, is on the front of the horse, you see the same cloaked figure riding the horse. Glances back over the shoulder and you can see what appears to be a pale-skinned human woman, looks in her twenties or so, but same outfit. And looks back and checks on him. He's stirring a little bit, and she glances back and goes, "Be patient. We're almost there." (hoofbeats)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That'll do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Am I with him in the vision?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you're watching him as his eyes glaze over for a moment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that'll do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where is he?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're taking him home.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, yes, we knew that!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're on horseback. They're already quite far... I don't know precisely where they are, but if we can make our way to--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wildmount.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. What's our fastest method there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're going by horse. They'll probably be there sooner rather than later, would be my guess.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't know where any trees are in Wildmount?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The closest tree that we've ever been to was the one we used to get to Draconia, but I don't know how close Draconia is to him. I can try and scry on where they are and look and see for the biggest tree myself and pop out right there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, the city that Tary's from--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Deastok.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It would be best to go there and cut them off. We know that they're coming from the west. There's got to be a way to get there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I scry on Deastok?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can only scry on locations that you've seen or been to.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And people that I have connections to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: People you can scry on with certain levels of knowing them or hearing about them and such.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How far is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of the spell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Instead of choosing a creature. But I could try and scry on Tary again and get a nearby tree?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's only a ten-foot radius to see anything clearly around the center, so you'd have to be pretty close to a tree for you to make it out enough.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have any images or any books here on Deastok that I can look at and then try and scry on, and then after I have the knowledge?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Doty's book? He might have written some things about it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gilmore's been many places. He might have something from there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How far away is it? How far away is the city from us? How many days on horseback?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see. From Whitestone directly, it would be probably about-- you can't cross the channel on horseback, but if you were to start at the other side of the Shearing Channel on horseback and ride, let's say 12 hours a day, you could probably get there in about four days. Three to four days.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So if we misted...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It still wouldn't be enough time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, just bamf there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have to bamf there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Two days. Go to Emon, talk to Shaun. He's been everywhere.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scry on her again!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Draconia. How close would Draconia be to this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, do we know how close Draconia is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Dremoth Ravine, with the remains of Draconia, would probably be about 150, 200 miles from it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not bad. We could misty from Draconia.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, we could.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But you can't Tree Stride today, can you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you already used it on Allura.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that the same day? I thought we slept.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, that was the same day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you used it once today. You had a full night's sleep, got all your spells back, and then you sent Allura off once today.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we have two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So that was today. I could do it again, and then I can Misty Step us, and then I would be out of my 6th, 7th, and 8th-level spells. I would be burning higher spell slots to get us there, but I could do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could be there-- We could be there in hours, if need be.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's do it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You have no books here on Deastok? None in Whitestone?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's look in the Doty book real fast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. There's a lot of writing in here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Towards the beginning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Towards the beginning, it talks about Deastok. It talks about the frustrations of the small-town life and the open world around and all the adventures they're seeking there. It's not written to show any detail or interest about the city where he grew up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (groans) All right, to Draconia! Let's go!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Gear up, everyone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Everyone, the Uber will be here in five minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you guys gather your materials, make your way to the Sun Tree, and Keyleth, you open Transport Via Plants to the exterior of the Dremoth Ravine in the ruins of Draconia. And that's where we'll take a break!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why can't anybody be nice?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She was fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, if you're really frustrated with how untrustworthy this NPC is, you can thank chat for it!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Thank the chat?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The chat did this to us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck you, chat!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You turned our own bakery against us! You!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To be fair, carbs are never really your friend, are they?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They are in workouts!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: S-A-M-S-S-H-I-R-T. Sam's shirt.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sam's shirt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey guys, welcome back to Critical Role. We have our winner in the chat. Tonight's winner is FormaldehydeG. You win. Denova will contact you via a whisper to get your contact and shipping information, and you will get your awesome prize of your Wyrmwood box.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (mocking) Prize.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (Christopher Walken voice) Prize.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. So, jumping back into the game. You guys have learned of the current whereabouts of Taryon Darrington. Proceeding in the direction of which he is getting transported. Which, let's go ahead and take a moment here, actually. Taryon, as you've come to consciousness on the back of this horse and you hear this woman, cloaked and riding in front of you, tell you, "We're almost there," and then (hoofbeats). You're hopping around on the back, bound. You try and move your arms and legs, and they're tied tightly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Doty! Doty. I'm having a dream again. Doty? Oh boy. Ugh. Hello? You there, driver person! Hello?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The head looks back over. "Oh! You've awakened. Isn't that very interesting?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's going on? Where are you taking me? Have I won a lottery of some sort?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You could say that, perhaps. Yes. I have a contract to bring you back to Deastok, and I am "fulfilling that contract."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no. Did my father pay you to do this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Howaardt Darrington? Because if so, yes."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then that is where you are going."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will pay you whatever he has promised you, double, if you let me go right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She shakes her head for a second. "I've looked through your belongings. You do not have "the money you speak of."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will write you a check and I will guarantee it with the name Taryon Darrington.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She laughs and turns back and focuses more on the horse riding.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just let it go and no one will get hurt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My apologies." (hoofbeats) And goes right back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I respect her so much. (sighs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (mouthing) What's her name?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't ask people names, friend. (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So what are the rest of you guys doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Running around like crazy people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We bamfed through the tree, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. Yep. So you gathered your elements and you transport through one of the trees that you created on the outside of the Dremoth Ravine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's right. We grew them a forest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh my god. That's right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The last time we came here, we came flying out of a tree on an angle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On an angle, yeah. You do not come through that same tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Off the edge of a cliff. (laughs nervously) It's a theme.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, so which way is Wildmount?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Northeast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this area, it would be northeast, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So I say we head north first. Find the main road.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're on Wildmount the continent, but you're heading more towards the city of Deastok, which is on the outskirts of the Dwendalian Empire.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We did know that they were on a road headed west. Heading east. Which means if we head north and then the minute that we hit that main road start heading in that direction, we might even pass them on the way and be able to identify a horse.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Especially if we're in like fart form.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so you guys are going into your Wind Walk form?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Before we do. Percy, do you know anything about this country we're in? Anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a history check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: History check, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This one you're going towards is called the Dwendalian Empire. This is the strongest and the most functional empire this side of Exandria. It is a tyranny. There is a king, and the law is ruled absolutely through this king. It is a functional economy. Its people aren't mistreated, from what you've read, though it is-- I want to say, it's very Prussian. People work, people live, people die.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Harsh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a harsh environment. It's a colder environment. Whereas the center of Tal'Dorei is a lot of fields and rolling hills across the midsection framed by mountains, across Wildmount, it is a smattering of mountain ranges and spires throughout, and chunks of forest. It is a much harsher environment, as far as the topography and the biomes than Tal'Dorei, and as such, the pockets where people do live, they live as well as they can amongst a very oppressive environment.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What's the name of the city, one more time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Deastok.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, this is Deastok. Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Deastok. So it's a bit Prussian?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay. That will do. So don't expect a lot of hospitality, and let's just have our business, get it done, and get out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, we can't talk when we're farts, so when we get there, what's the plan, plan man?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to fly up until we see the main road. We see the main road, we're going to take it towards the city. We're going to stay a bit high. If anyone spots a lone horse and a rider with a human-sized package on the back, we're going to do a little spin-around, spin-around, spin-around, and we're all going to park ourselves maybe a quarter of a mile up the road.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I like that idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What happens if we don't see the person on the horse? What happens? We just land right outside the gates and ring the bell?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We land inside the gates.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, but that seems a little dicey if we want to work out what we're going to do. We're just going to appear and say howdy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: From what I know of this city, it's not a locked city, is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not a locked city. There are perimeter walls and there are gates that can close in case of times of war. You do know that there is a strong military presence in most cities and there are patrols that often make sure that peace is kept.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So we can walk in if we need to, but let's not make any waves unless we need to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it has a strong standing military and they do exercise it in times of peace as a form of law enforcement.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You and Tary are thick as thieves, now. How plugged in is his dad?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Super. Right? I mean, he's not the most powerful guy, but he does well for himself. He runs an area.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The way Taryon talks about his father is he is a land baron in Deastok. He owns a number of plots and homes and farms and collects taxes on them. His family has been doing this for at least a generation or two and has made quite a fortune off of it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And his sister's name is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His sister's name is Maryanne.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maryanne. That's creative. Okay. All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, Maryanne Darrington.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And his mom is Mariya. (laughs) All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mariya and Howaardt?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mariya and Howaardt Darrington.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: See, I know his mother's name!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Do you go ahead and accept Keyleth's Wind Walk? All right. With a moment of concentration, you all convert yourselves into plumes of smoke, mist. By the way, did you leave Doty behind or take Doty with you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can't take him with us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Okay, then. Doty is back in Whitestone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, yeah, he doesn't respond to us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, we would have had to have had--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just say no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, we didn't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, you guys convert to your--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He doesn't go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Who are you talking to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all coast in the shapes of mist into the moist, freezing air over the Dremoth Ravine and head northward. You guys move as a cluster of small plumes of moisture. As you look forward over the next-- 300 feet a round, at double speed--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Carry the three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Doing air math; it's great. Nothing quite like air math.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The topography does seem at least to be somewhat in line with what you saw the brief time that you scryed upon Taryon.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm just heading the direction--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That smoke plume definitely--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That smoke plume knows where it's going.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't hear you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys all continue heading east.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we have normal mental thoughts when we're smoke plumes? Or do we just think in terms of (wind noises)?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you think normally. You're still mentally you. You just can't talk. If you do talk, it comes out as (blows raspberry).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (blows raspberry)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does it sound like if you laugh?

lines.name: LIAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: (airy laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry. We're going.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys continue pushing east...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to be keeping an eye out for anybody on the road.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ditto.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception check from the two of you guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see this village on top of this cleared hill surrounded by farmland and then surrounded by forest and what appear to be some broken mountain ranges maybe a few miles out each direction.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I keep skirting around, looking for a lone horseman.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I fly down and see if I see any signs along the road? Any markers saying what city it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You cruise down and begin riding a little closer to the surface. With your general, even passive perception, you do catch what appears to be-- there are a few splinter trails that seem to be the perimeter on the outside of where the forest leads inward and heads along the outskirts of the tree line. There you do see a sign. The arrow leads forward towards what is called the Siren Green Forest, and then eastward towards Deastok. You gather that the large town on this carved hilltop seems to be the town in question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But nobody on horseback?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see anybody on horseback at the moment, no.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (hiccups)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) Is that the cloud hiccups?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maybe any of the paths off the main road where someone might be hiding and just run through the trees looking for anything. I'm searching around a little bit. I know we're close to the city, and I'm keeping an aerial view because we should be able to see an awful lot from high up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. You see hundreds of acres of farmland that surround this large hill. It's built all across the top of the hill then built along the front side of it. You can see a number of paths that zigzag down. Elements of it sprawl a bit into the farm, but the majority of the metropolis is on top of the hill itself, and then the farmland around it. You do see, as you get closer and skirt the sides, there are patrols. You see men on horseback with crossbows slung over the side that do perimeters. Some of them are weaving independently through the fields, keeping an eye on people who are in the process of harvesting.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No interest of getting anywhere near that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The rest of you guys continue heading east towards the town, or are you following?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm popping back on the road.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Percival catches up to you guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: At this point, I feel like our option is only to go towards the house, if we can find his family's keep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did we beat him here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. There's no way to know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can land and have a conversation.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you guys (whoosh) make your way to the-- where do you want to land?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe the edge of town, into the Siren Gate Forest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you find the edge of the tree line before it opens up into the farmland surrounding the city. As you all take a moment to concentrate, your forms congeal once more into your physical selves and you are able to discuss as you prefer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well! Anybody see anything?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is it possible she could've put some kind of covering over them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like we did with Whitestone or something?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Many things are possible, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we still see their tracks if we went back and looked? That would be a ranger question.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, it's just horse tracks, but I can look. Horse tracks on a main road. Unless Tary is thinking and he's leaving something behind so that we can track him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tary, can you hear us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tary? Good idea, Percy!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing at the moment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have to be within 500 feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could try Commune With Nature, but it only extends for a few miles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to cast Locate-- oh, should I do that? Should I waste it right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long does it last?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten minutes. I'm going to try. Wait, a thousand feet. That's not very far, compared to where the city is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A few miles is better.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus, that's a concentration spell. The mist form is my concentration spell, so we should be able to do both at once, correct? If we move quickly while she has her Locate Object on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Let's do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to try to locate his dangly earring.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Dangly bits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: His dangly bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: His penis!

lines.name: ASHLEY, TRAVIS, MARISHA
lines.text: Penis!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: His Tary.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (giggling) His Tary!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Going down to Tary-town.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt's doing something.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, it's something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. I was making sure the Wind Walk wouldn't affect any concentrations.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's doing trigonometry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Squaring his hypotenuse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you're attempting Locate Object on Taryon's earring, you said?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: His dangly bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You focus and concentrate. It does not pick up within a thousand feet of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. So we're going to misty form towards the city and see if we can...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (whoosh) You all head back up into the sky, and you can see now the clouds in this vicinity are growing darker. It looks like it's probably going to rain in the next few hours or so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. So we're less noticeable?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The temperature right now means it might even sleet; you're not sure. You make your way, coasting over the farmland. Looking down, you can see it's all segmented and all marked off with various colored fences. Everything is really well-organized here, and all the land has been divided. You eventually make your way towards the base of the hill and cruise up to the outskirts of the city, where you see the large stone walls that encircle elements of the outskirts, and you see where each one of these walls opens up to some sort of a pathway. There is a large metallic gate that is currently separated and lifted up in the back that can be slammed and closed and shut in case you need to keep anybody in or out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ping!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're getting no ping yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No pings? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What do you do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we backtrack?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're over his family's keep?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know what his family's keep looks like.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But we're over the city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're over the city right now, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we theoretically haven't intercepted them yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to try and motion everyone to follow me in a circle around the city and then back out the front gate.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You move pretty fast. It's a big radius to go around the entire wall perimeter of the city. At your full speed, I'd say you can do a full pass in about 15 minutes or so. That's a careful cruising through. Nothing seems to ping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we beat him. Maybe we beat him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh Matt, I forgot to tell you. When I left home, I left a large eternal flame burning on my keep's roof. Is that okay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know. Maybe we beat her. I'm going to try and motion everyone--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Back out to the fucking woods?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just a little. Not far.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back out to the woods? Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Back onto the road. And off the road so that we're not super visible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're heading back over the farmland, back to the outskirts of the Siren Gate Forest into the tree line?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: About an hour's walk to the city is where I want to put us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: To where we can see the city and see the road coming to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, cool. So you guys find your way there. You wait for a moment to make sure the patrols aren't anywhere nearby, and you turn back into your physical selves.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we've either beat them here or she's really clever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or she took off all of his clothing and he's riding around naked.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But she would still theoretically have his clothing. It would still exist.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, hopefully.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you think, you think we should camp out here for a while and keep an eye on the road for a day or two? See if we can intercept? And if they never show up, then we need to figure out going into the city.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we have a way of scrying one more time before the day is up?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, then let's scry one more time and see if we beat them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can do one of two things. I can either scry on them, or I can do a Commune With Nature spell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Scry!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right. Scry!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Your vision shifts once more to Taryon, who uncomfortably, like "Ow, ow, ow" on the back of this horse a little bit, and as you start audibly making a pained sound, a hand grabs the back of where the ropes are entwined and shifts you in the back of the seat to be a little more comfortable.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, thank you!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No response from her. Still riding on the back of the horse. It's getting darker now, and you can see the clouds are still a little pushing towards that stormy look that you saw when you were in the city. So they're still on the road. They're still traveling.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But it's the road that we've...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seems familiar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is the sun in the same direction that we're heading?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. The sun's more westward at this point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So we could, in theory, mist low to the ground on this road in that direction, and in theory catch up with them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And he's conscious. Which is good. He's still alive.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And he has his clothing on.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good. That's good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We won't see his dangling bits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just the one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just the one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Should we mist that way?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I say we mist that way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And intercept him.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I like that idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, let's intercept them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you guys go back into mist form (whoosh) and begin coasting westward along the path. You travel for about ten minutes before Vex and Vax, you pick up what looks to be a small dark shape on the road.

lines.name: LIAM, LAURA
lines.text: (whoosh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so what do you do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're trying to signal everyone!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is there forest on the sides of the road from where we are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're in open fields.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So open fields and roads. Shite. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! But wait! Turn back into-- wait--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't talk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I turn back into a thing!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you go and land. Vex lands and takes a minute to concentrate and go back to her physical form.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're up ahead! Maybe we should just bamf here, be solid. I can disguise the landscape and we can ambush her!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So I do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Should we set a fallback?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You guys, does this make us highway bandits? Are we highway bandits?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As she's saying that, I start using--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have about a minute until she gets to you right now, by the way. You're able to see the horse traveling a little above the road, so they're almost upon you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god. What do we do? She knows all of us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to start making my way a decent distance and running a little bit off the road, I'm going to try and find some cover and get ready to injure a horse.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who wants to stand in the middle of the road?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And what's on the sides of the road? Is it tall grass, bald?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's maybe knee-high grass with sections of bald. The landscape here, outside of the farmland and the forest that you can see, looks a little hard and badlands-ish. Scrubland.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to go 200, 300 yards back towards the city, just in case they manage to get through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you're getting down, you're doing that...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to get into some grass, as close to the road as I can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bamf Trinket out! And we get in the grass and stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Roll a stealth check. Disadvantage for Trinket.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I cast Pass Without a Trace!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. And for Trinket, with disadvantage because he's a big bear.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh that's a good one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, he got a 19, which is a crit for him! That sucks. 19!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, it's not a crit. That's only on attacks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. Well, still.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It's a critical stealth!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus ten!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh wait, did you want someone in the middle of the road?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll stand in the middle of the road.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Unassuming.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Unassuming, okay. I'm going to go into crow form. (caws)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe I can act like I'm an old woman trying to cross the road.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you go into crow form.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to aid to her bird lady aesthetic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stealth roll, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stealth roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And stealth roll for you, too, Vax.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do drows have magic sight or anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a reliable talent, in fact.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus ten!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Plus ten. 31!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Grog's a ways back.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not stealthing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I'm getting down. I'm preparing for the shot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ditto!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to pull up my cloak and slowly start crossing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm also going to activate the secondary mechanism in the Diplomacy glove.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I follow Pike and peck at her bread crumbs as she crosses the road.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! All right, so as this is happening, and this is a really fast rush over, rush over, get into places, and you watch as the horse has galloped (hoofbeats). You have Pike in the middle of the road, dressed the same in memory.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The waiting.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you watch as the horse (hoofbeats) goes off the path and begins to make a wide circle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Motherfucker! She's going around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seemingly, yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Excuse me! Ma'am?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Full gallop burst.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take off in crow form.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was actually going to-- the second she started to leave the road, I take a shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At the horse's legs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll heal it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an attack with disadvantage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you're aiming specifically for the legs.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I burn a grit for it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, you do technically have an actual-- yeah, so you will not have disadvantage on this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll burn a grit for this. This is worth a grit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Horse killing is a feat you took, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're gods, remember?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Remember that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's not great, but it's not bad. 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 20 will hit. So what's the effect on that one, again?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a strength saving throw or prone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's the DC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you watch. No gunshot. Complete silence as you all begin to maneuver. You watch as the horse suddenly (neighs) and goes ass over tea kettle forward, jettisoning both Taryon and the rider from the horse into a neat roll. Since you have not moved, Tary, you make a full spill, skittering across the ground.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (screams)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You suffer ten points of bludgeoning damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about the horse. Does he fall off?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, the horse is prone and still takes damage from the shot, so roll damage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, and also takes damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because you shot it with...

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did. I really shot it. It didn't have a good day. Do I have enough...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll heal it so good!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm going to eat it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's 30 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30 points of damage!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that a lot for a horse?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's my maximum damage with a single unaffected shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, as the horse skids over and hits the ground, it falls onto its side, and you watch its heavy breathing become still.

lines.name: LAURA, ASHLEY
lines.text: No!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dinner!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm keeping a second shot. The second I see her head, I am taking a head shot on this girl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a perception check because you were down in the grass.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I lift my head up. What's going on?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't, because you are tied.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you see nothing. What were you doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whoosh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you (whoosh) up in the air. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm brooming.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're brooming towards. All right, so she comes to a tumble. For this purpose, I'm going to have you two, since you're both pretty quick, roll initiative checks, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jesus. Okay. So. You both rush over and you watch as she tumbles and catches herself, skidding into the dirt. You can see bits where she's rubbed and gashed in the face. Pale skin, blonde hair, nowhere near the description that you were given by those who were trying to scry earlier, but catches herself and lands, reaches over and sees Taryon about three feet behind and immediately darts over, grabbing something from the satchel--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I shoot her with an arrow?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would've taken your movement to get to her, but you can move half as quickly and go for a shot if you want to.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to try to go for a shot.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How close are we, right in this second?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you're going to close the distance because you're apparently a bullet. Learn to balance your magical items, people!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or not.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or let your players spread them out and not keep them all for themselves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly, yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Salt, salt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all good. So you'll be able to get your shots off about the time that you get there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Salty. Oh no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You got a four because of all that salt.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I know. That was 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The first, and then more than that on the second.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so both hit. Go ahead and roll damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, is it too late to say I want one to be a bramble shot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can bramble shot, sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! Okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You decide a bramble shot as you hit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, sweet! DC of 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: DC of 17? Not with an eight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's restrained!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's restrained.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice. That's huge.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pretty calm fight music, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The volume is really low on that speaker. My apologies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 13 plus eight is 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There we go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 21 plus eight is 29, plus 1d6 lightning damage. 29 plus six is 35! 35 on the first shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then 16. 24 on the second, and I was wrong, add two more to the first shot because I forgot I was using my bracers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so 37, got it. So you (flying arrows) and fire both off as your broom is coasting inward from an arc and the first arrow catches her in the knee and she (yelps) and is still reaching for Taryon. However, as the arrow smashes into her, it bursts into a series of thorny vines that (whoosh) wrap around and ensnare her and she falls over, now bound like Taryon is for the moment. Falls on the ground. Whatever was in her hand stumbles forward.

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And she's like (grunts) reaching out just as the second arrow hits her in the back and (groans) gives out a yelp in pain. Vax.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What distance am I right now, would you say?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You almost closed the distance with your movement.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Get in there, Barry Allen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, but am I within 50 feet? 60 feet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're within 60 feet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 60 feet? All right, so I'm going to throw Whisper at her, and she's brambled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's restrained; you have advantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 20, 26, 27, 31, 34, 39, 42. With Whisper, right into her back, and then click the Boots of Haste and then I'm going to scuttle to Tary and cut ropes. He's probably within ten feet, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he's like five feet from her.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so I'm cutting him totally loose and I'm going to lift him away. Whatever you'll let me do. Action, action, bonus action, right, and movement to get there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, no. Your movement was to get there, your action was to attack her, and so you have your bonus action, still.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Then I'll use it to cut him loose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, you begin to cut him loose. Because there's a lot of ropes around him, there's not a single binding.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Good enough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: what's the DC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. She does manage to break free from the restraints. She breaks free from the vines, and then she puts her hands up. That's her turn.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I land?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. If anyone else wants to take any of their actions right now, we're technically not in initiative order. She's put her hands up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm slowly making my way a little closer to the action, but I'm going to find a place where I can watch both sides of the road and also what's happening off the road right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm writing my name in the path with a stick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm grabbing the thing that she was trying to grab.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Same as Percy, but as a crow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Actually, if you come-- well, that would be interesting, actually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (caws)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What you find on the ground is a small marble, similar in size to the one that you saw attached to the side of Doty earlier, but it's a different color. The one that you saw earlier was a bluish tint, a light blue tint. This one appears clear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I pick it up? I'll pocket that shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I stand up yet? Am I still tied up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the moment, as all of you begin to converge and close in on her, she just has her hands up at this point. I'd say for the next minute or so, you get cut free, yeah. You still have your armor on, you still have all your equipment that was on you. Yeah, she took everything with you. You're not robbed. You were just bound and taken.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You all right, T?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will, yeah. (panting) What took you people so long? I was on a horse for what felt like days!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, initially we thought you could handle it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No! You know me better than that!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're here, aren't we?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pounding.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Please tell me that someone brought my toothbrush.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Your breath smells disgusting right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I went to sleep. I don't know what this is! I mean. She's taking me. She's paid by my father, probably.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's your name?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "K'ryyn."

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: K'ryyn?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And what, you work for my father? On a regular basis?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I was contracted by your father. This is the first time."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just to find him? And bring him back?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's what I do."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much were you being paid? I want to know how much he's worth.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're not really in a position of power here, darling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Upon delivery, I was to be paid 5,000 gold pieces."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's nearly nothing. I'm worth far more than that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know his father has way more money than that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You are rose gold.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long ago did he send you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He sent me out on this job about two months back."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It took that long to find him? Does anyone in this town, Deastok, know about Whitestone? Know where you found him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not to my knowledge. I don't care about people in this town. I was called here to pick up "the contract, and I left."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What guild do you work for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I work for no guild. I am a solo agent."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I insight check her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She's so cool. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17? She's hard to read. By nature and by business, you get the sense, and at this point as you're looking at her, she sees you glaring and looking over her intensely, she (sighs) takes one hand up under her hood and presses her thumb to the side of what looks like a small circlet, and her image shimmers and you now see before you the drow elf that was described to you, wincing as the sun is still in the sky and you can see, while the illusion did not seem to give off that, she's physically not enjoying being under direct sunlight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bet you're glad for that cloud cover today, aren't you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's been helpful. That's why I prefer to do most of my work in Wildmount."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What should we do here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we should bind her and search her. Make sure she's not holding any weapons or anything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You were just supposed to bring Tary back to his dad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is all. Unharmed. I took great care to make sure he was not harmed. I have a business I "run based purely on reputation."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I respect that, but I did get a bruise right here from the horse falling over, so I'm not totally okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That is, apparently, an issue for you to take up with your friends."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tary, I thought you left your home. Or were you kicked out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I left.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. I left of my own accord.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you leave suddenly, without any word, or did they know you were leaving?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They knew I was leaving.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And how do you want to play this? Because your pops wants you back, obviously.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, this is just some paid shithead, so I don't think we should kill her or anything like that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What happens if you don't deliver your quarry?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then my contract is broken, I do not get paid, and it is a blight on future business."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you armed? Somebody remove her weapons so she can put her arms down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You pat her down? Yeah, she has two daggers, one placed in each boot, stealthily hidden. She has a shortbow that is over her chest and shoulder, and a side quiver of about 40 arrows.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit! These are good arrows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes, "Thank you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just noticed the good work, that's all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I make them myself."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I show her one of my owlbear arrows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Owlbear?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you want to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want to take her belongings and send her on her way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't want to see her dead?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a separate question, isn't it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is unacceptable behavior, I think, in any relationship. This is not cool, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he should have offered way more money for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, yes, there's that, too.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She did surrender. I'm just thinking, maybe we go in, she gets paid, she keeps her reputation, and then you can--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You want her to get paid? She kidnapped me!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You should still make your dad pay, though!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You could say, I would've come here--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She committed a crime against me. I don't want her to get money!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're having this conversation, she slowly puts her hands down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm still watching.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And she surrendered, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry. I guess I was raised with a different appreciation for money, but Pike, your family came in and robbed us and you gave them a bunch of gold. Then this person kidnapped me, and you want to give her 5,000 gold.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We want your dad to have to give her 5,000 gold.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: And if you show up with all of us and her, say you could've just called, I would've shown up, but you still have to pay her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You think he'll be guilted?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, I don't know. I don't know him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it might be an easy way into the city.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I live in the city. I'll just walk in!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe she owes us one after this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's my house!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we all be in disguise?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you sure you're cool to walk in right now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes! I'm Taryon fucking Darrington. People shake when they see me walking down the street here.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You know, she was able to find you. Maybe she could also find somebody else for us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: A very good friend.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think that's a wonderful idea.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Maybe she owes us one. K'ryyn, would you like to owe us a favor if we let you live, and get you paid, and you keep your reputation all on the same day?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you are serious."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We are. We want you to find someone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then find them, I will."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I abstain! With an attitude!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Noted. All in favor of getting her paid, letting her live, and earning a favor?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, hold on, Tary. If you had it your way, what would you want?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Majority rules, but let's hear what you have to say.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I would like an apology.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's fair.

lines.name: LAURA, ASHLEY
lines.text: That's fair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Her eyes become these narrow slits and the jaw clenches. "I apologize for any discomfort or "embarrassment my retrieval of you may have caused."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a good apology.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And as to the amount that was promised, do you think that was a fair amount?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, this is a bit much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was my standard rate."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't get any of your belongings back! Is that all right?

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (negative noises)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She might need it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't get any of your magical belongings back! I want it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I want you to look at them. I want to know what it is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. But we'll, I guess, walk in together and you can present me to my father. This seems so stupid, but sure, I'll go along with it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then you'll help us out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. It seems we are at an accord."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to yank Vex aside, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I'm going to shake her hand before-- shit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you talking about what I think you are talking about?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to send her after your friend?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Our friend.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You think he wants a mercenary showing up in his life, looking for him? Think about it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He could be dead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's doing what he wants to do.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did I overhear them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How quiet were you guys being?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pretty quiet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glean elements of the conversation.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I wasn't trying to hide it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you get the gist of what they were talking about.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. She doesn't have to bring him or anything, it could be just looking, bring us information if she sees him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like a two-day report.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We don't have to! We don't have to do it, but I do like the idea of this woman-- this woman had a job to do. It's not her fault. I'm sorry, Tary, but I do feel like we need to let her complete her mission.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a bit her fault.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fine. And then we can send her to look after that little creep that you're always talking about.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: When you were in Vasselheim--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was a cube, Tary. Like a cube.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's gross. That's disgusting.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How would you feel if you learned that we'd sent someone to watch you? He left. He wanted to go. He wanted to be away from us.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If he wants to come back, I want him back.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I know, but I feel like he should've come back already.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if he's dead?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What if he's dead?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What if he's being a father to his child? What if he's enjoying his life?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Boring.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If that's the case, then maybe she can tell us that and then we'll leave it alone. But what if he's dead?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why doesn't she just owe us one favor to be claimed later?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes, I like that idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I fly down to Pike's shoulder and I go, (caws).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I know, right?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: See, she thinks-- I like that idea. She owes us a favor at some point.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But I want to find Scanlan!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Maybe we should table it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, let's go talk to my dad and get this settled, and then we'll figure out your next assignment or whatever.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You'll hang out, though? You're not going to disappear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I have business still to make, and you have been merciful, so I will remain."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I fly over to Percy's shoulder and I go, (caws).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am Groot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Very well. Into the city, then?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Mister Darrington, welcome home."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. These are my friends. They should be treated with respect.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course. Good day."

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: Bidet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He continues clomping by, (hoofbeats), making his way down the rest of his patrol.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to be a dark window, isn't it? This entire trip.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, the town was never the problem. It's a fine place to grow up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm very curious. Let's see this place.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll go ahead and drop form so I'm not a bird.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ow! Oh god!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, I always forget that. I'm so sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's all right, it's not my shooting arm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm learning, still.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Here, let me just--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, ow. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll need a bit more later. Thanks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Tary?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, oi?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, you know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, you're right. We can't punish people who are just hired to do a job. It's fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's how we all started out, really.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I hired you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's got a point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll be on broom.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I be on broom, too, though?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Behind me. And I should be front and center. You guys can flank--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Flying V behind you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I catch up to Tary a little bit and I go, hey! Are you special in some way? Is there something about you that's magical and special?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Most things are special about me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true. Is there a reason a vampire would want you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? There's vampires here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you have special blood?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No? Wait, what?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I look at your eyes?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, sure? They're the bluest of blue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true! Do you know anything about your bloodline? Is there something about you? I feel like I have an essence about you now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How much of her brains were left in the rocks?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, she got rattled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, she's gone full Phoebe from Friends.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm off to the side with Grog going one, two, three, shoot!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My town here, it doesn't have very many high hills, but still, stay on the ground, will you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys make your way through the streets, in the presentational mode of which Taryon has requested, people do stop and stare. You can hear whispers, some folks pointing, some of the patrols gather to keep a close eye as you pass. No excitement, no parade, no cursing or aggression, just acknowledgement of the arrival of these strangers and a very flashy lord. Eventually, you lead them to the Darrington estate. This is a large, three-story building surrounded by tall, iron pike-topped gates that surround the somewhat octagonal shape of the grounds. The main gate is watched by a single man in a simple leather outfit and a metallic helmet. Who, as he sees you approach goes, "Have you-- sir! Welcome home!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. Tell the master of the house that we've arrived.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. Right away, sir!" Opens the gate and rushes off to the front door and disappears inside for a moment. The door opens again, and you see emerging from it a very tall, thin, brass-scaled dragonborn with very fine clothing. His lack of tail speaks of his Ravinite lineage. You recognize this individual as Berthold; he is the servant of the house and quarters. As he approaches he goes, "Oh, Master Taryon, it has been some time! Good to see you in good health!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, excellent to see you, too. You've been keeping the grounds quite nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "My son."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Papa.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a nod to you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You'll wait for us outside the grounds, and we'll give you your next assignment soon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As soon as they walk down the stairs he turns and goes, "I am glad to see you are well."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you? You sent that woman to kidnap me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I sent that woman to bring you home. To see that you were safe."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She bound and gagged me and threw me on the back of a horse. That's how you brought me home?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're a hard man to find when you want to be."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am literally the least hard man to find. I tell everyone my name, I wear a gold helmet, and I walk around talking about myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His smile fades for a moment. "And yet you were very far from these lands."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I was. I was living a new life, as I told you I would. I was finding myself and becoming someone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You fill your head with these fantasies and ideals "and step out into the unknown. Do you know how many men and women are found gutted in the streets "and left and abandoned to rot away in forests by some bandits on the roadside? Not to mention the "various beasts of the wild out there. I was worried about you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's for me, not for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Taryon... while my parenting may have been strict or distant at times, I didn't reflect "on my care for you. We have a legacy in this family to maintain."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I know. That's all you seem to care about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's all that matters."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not all that matters. I know that I carry your blood and that means a lot to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This money that you seem to relish in, that you took without asking, the last of our "coffers. Your grandfather started this, and I've done everything to maintain it. And your "interests, your attention, could not be brought to learn and maintain this business after me, so I've "had to turn to Maryanne. It's not that I don't love you, but you have another purpose in this "family. And that is why I've brought you here."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And what is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you watch as his hands are shaking and he's fidgeting and scratching his chin and running his fingers through his sideburns. "We're impoverished. I haven't been able to pay our staff "in nearly two months. Everything that I had to do to maintain this legacy has come back to bear "fruit, and the debt that we owe is vast."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't believe you. Where's the money? Where's the family money?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks around at the rest of you, and you can see now there is trepidation with having this conversation in front of strangers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's all right. They're with me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This union will bring our family a renewed avenue "to wealth and protection within the empire! We can stave off this terrible end, and you will be a "hero within the family."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't understand. The way we lived, the way you talked, made it seem like there was endless money, forever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This stems to your lack of respect."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is this syndicate you speak of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lord Jaipher found loopholes to revoking our "ownership and titles set by Oberon and in my panic and necessity, I found an ally in the Myriad."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In the Myriad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Through a whispered hint, I met a man named Korshad, who ensured our surviving ownership in "trade for a partnership with him. I signed, not wanting to toss, at the time, my only child "onto the street. But as the decades passed, I did not realize in my haste, the depths of the deal "that I had made. And with many harvests failing in recent years, the agreement now devours our "livelihood from within. They now demand our accrued debt paid in full or they take full "ownership of everything."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm having trouble wrapping my head around this. You're saying everything I've lived has all been built on this deal with this shady group? You're a criminal? You're just a criminal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No. No, it is built on what we built as a family."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We didn't build anything as a family!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We did, and nearly had it taken away. I did this to maintain it. And I let you live as you all "deserved to live."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But Papa, you never told me any of this. You were cold to us, and you told us a bare minimum of what you did and how you ran things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I hoped to find a way to fix this before I needed to, yet here I am, prostrate before my own "child. Broken." And he starts, like, tears just pour down his cheeks. "I was just trying to make "it right."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't know any of this. How would I? And now I have to fix it for you by marrying some girl?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's a marriage of convenience."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's still a marriage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Your life is still yours to live."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's not! I have to be here, I have to be with her. I have to live in her castle or she in mine. (sighs) Listen, I've learned a lot from these people over the last year or so. And one thing I've learned is that you are who you are whether you have a lot of money or not. And I don't have that much anymore and I'm still okay with that. And it's not because of the things I own, it's because of the deeds that I do. You've done some bad deeds in your life, and it sounds like you've done them to preserve our family and preserve our legacy, but that's not a reason to do them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He leans forward to you and looks to you with an honest, more honest than you've seen him, very vulnerable expression. "Every man and woman who has money has done bad things."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I'm sure that's true. And I assume I'm somehow complicit in this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You are not. I tried to keep you, your sister, and your mother as innocent as I could. My "back is to a wall now."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll have to think about this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Think on it. The choice is still yours; I would not force you into this, but it is a chance "I wish you to contemplate."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What have you done to our name? Do people know of this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No."

lines.name: SAM
