lines.text: And if I marry this girl, it will just all go away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you marry this girl, we will have the influence and the wealth to pay this debt and cut "ties with the Myriad entirely. We would be a free family once more."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much debt are we talking?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "The last amount we were given: 230,000 gold."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well. That's a lot.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Is there any other way than marriage that you can think of?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I've exhausted the options I have at my disposal."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we just wipe out the Myriad?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He laughs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're far too big.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You underestimate the sheer size and how ingrained they are in the society here. This is no "guild. Wildmount

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And if I say no and they take all of our possessions and our estate, everything, what then? We're ruined.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We're on the street. We are but beggars within our own city, at the mercy of those we've "been taxing."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How could you do this to us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Because I loved you. I loved you all, and I did what was necessary."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I owe you that, at least. I never claimed to be a good man. I never claimed to be a good "father, good husband, but I can try to be better, can't I?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, you can. I'm going to go see Mother and Sister. Might my friends stay here the night?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course, and enjoy the grounds while you can."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This Korshad, and the Myriad, where do you meet with him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's been some time, but if you wish to seek him out, ask for who you can speak with the "Many, in the Grumpy Lily."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grumpy Lillian?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The Grumpy Lily. You know this to be one of the seedier bars in town.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I'm asking to speak with the Many?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're wishing to speak with the Many.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, good to see you. Have a good afternoon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm glad you're safe."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you. It's good to see you again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You too. More than you know, my son."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we leave the room?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, let's leave the room.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We could have cut that air with a knife.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So here's the thing, though. You said he like hated you, and he didn't seem like he hated you at all!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's acting differently than I recall. It's been a while. I'm not used to seeing him like this, and honestly, I don't know how to take it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, you can't marry that bitch.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You can't marry her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It seems like I have to.

lines.name: LAURA, ASHLEY
lines.text: No, you don't.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Got to do it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog says I do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Simplest. The shortest distance between two--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Two points.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. Is--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Marriage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Marriage. Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're getting so smart, Grog! So smart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't be jealous.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know some about the Myriad, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've encountered them once. Back in Stillben, back at the very beginning of your adventures. The very beginning.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy, this is the first you've heard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Rusty. Rusty Trombone?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Rusty Trombone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He was a weird character choice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you exit the study and close the door behind you, left in the cold, quiet silence of the house, you continue your conversation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Where is your sister?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much money did you take when you left?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I thought a meager amount. 50,000 gold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's a lot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But, I mean, considering the debt that they're in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's literally more than my entire tribe owns.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we have a lot more than that in our party fund.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know. We own more than my tribe owns.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I own more than your tribe owns.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Along with your earring. Very large other bits.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We were working on that particular compliment, and I feel like we have a little way to go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it all right? No? I thought that was a compliment.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Tell her she did good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you cool with your sister?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. I'm not cool with my sister. She's not that great.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is she married?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do you think she knows about this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess. I suppose she knows about this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And the last time you spoke with her was when you left, I'm assuming?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, that's right. She was being groomed as the heir to the family, and I was being shut out. My mother is here somewhere, too. She's pretty quiet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do you want to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess talk to them, but we can't go after the Myriad; they're powerful and dark.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if we offer services, and they excuse part of the debt?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, he offered services, and look where it got him.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Do you know Lydia?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've never met Lydia in your life. You don't even know what she looks like.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not even sure if that's something that should be entertained.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could go talk to them, but I don't see how that's going to change anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe she's a really cool girl that won't be into you and you can just hang out and be besties?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gross.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. I like being besties with you. I don't want some rando.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not fair to her, either.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not. Honestly, maybe we should just go talk to her first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lydia?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, she's in a whole other town.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Here's the thing, you're not going to marry her. Okay?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why not?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Because if he wants to be a better father to you, then he's going to let this go and not let you do this. If that means him being out on the street, that's my opinion.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's harsh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everything he is, is his status, though. This place, where he lives, his servants. If he's got nothing, then he's just... he'll die.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sometimes, when you let that go, only then are you able to truly live.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Whoa.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Deep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That is maybe true, but listen. I've been working on this for a year, and I'm starting to get really nervous. I'm down to my last few bits of gold, and I don't know how that would feel to run out.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't even have any money.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because you gave it all away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Technically, I've got a lot of money.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Money gives you everything you want.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's the best thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, but you're thrifty. You're good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I'm not thrifty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, you are! Taryon, I've seen make amazing things. You can survive. You've been to the depths of the watery abyss. And you've lived, kind of.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a bad example.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm really wishing we had taken a lot more money from Thordak. If we had taken more money, everything would be fine right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No! That's not the lesson of the story, you guys!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, money would have solved this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No! Not the lesson, not the lesson we're supposed to take away!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Keyleth is right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't have an alternative for the lesson. It's just not the lesson.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're here. We can figure out a way out of this. We're smart, we're clever, we're powerful. And what's one more cliff?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we're gods!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not going to say that ever again.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I say we go talk to the Many.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, let's go talk to the Many.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I understand this is very complicated. Are we really looking for a solution to fix several generations of your family's misdeeds? It sounds like your father, your grandfather have been navigating murky waters for some time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want to find out what your sister knows.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know what the right decision is, either. Do you marry this woman to fix decades of terrible decisions?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't necessarily see how two wrongs right anything here. It's just really kicking the ball down the road while you make another random human being you have not met miserable.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I assume I would be a fine husband.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You'd be amazing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like I'd be okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You make really good blondies, and many things besides blondies, as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. You'll be miserable, and that will make her miserable.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, it's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Which is: do we worry about your family's life, their safety? Are they safe here, or are they gonna be eaten alive?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'd assume they are not safe here. We'd have to convince them to leave, or protect them somehow, or make a deal to at least protect them in poverty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we just talk to the Myriad, talk to Korshad and see what we can do. Maybe he needs something, and we can provide it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm sure it would be worth their time to get us out of town, possibly get you out of town. You can't be good for business.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Well, a quick stop to talk to my sister, possibly, and then let's go at least investigate this contact.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: God, this sucks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I appreciate you all being here for me. I'm sorry. I didn't realize that this was going to happen and I don't want-- if you fellows want to go back and just continue on, I can solve this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Nah, man! You're one of us now!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just next time you get abducted by a bounty hunter, give us some warning, would you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll try. Maybe I should sleep with bells on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would be a good idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're halfway there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Percy, can you make me some?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Some bells? Absolutely. I'm going to regret this, but yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't let them hold you down.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I thought you liked that hat.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like that you approve of the arranged marriage, but it's the bells that really--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, you don't get to keep eyes on me all hours of the day.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'll walk through the place and look for sis.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and we'll pick up there next week, as it is 11:00, we'll pick this up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Your dad is not what I expected!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (singing) Me, neither!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ugh!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mercer!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Matthew Mercer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You have a way of taking our backstories that we think we've created and then just flipping it on us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing happened.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, Grog jumped off a roof and died.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Was it 1,000 feet? Yeah, all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He actually can take that much damage, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 360 points?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, raging, reduced to half. Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Technically, I don't think falling damage counts as weapon damage. I don't know if you can take half damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, bludgeoning, it would.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bludgeoning.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn it! (laughs)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, half damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How many hit points do you have?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A lot.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He doesn't like to brag.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome, guys. We'll see how this goes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's not a lot of real sound family structures in this campaign.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We all have such terrible families.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We all have shitty families.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let this be a lesson.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mom was great.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, Mom was real great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She was the best.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Every fucking moment of my backstory, man. I'm so excited for this shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Bonus backstory.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys keep creating-- you act like you didn't hand me backstories with traumatic relationships with your parents already.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're so dark, man. Why do you make this shit up?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was years ago!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: One fucking page.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I take what I'm given, and I extrapolate.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, you do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You came up with most of that shit off on your own. You didn't even write it down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, for some of it I had.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he had a lot of it, and then a few things from this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Maryanne was off the cuff?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I think I had their names written down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you did.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, for anyone who has been asking: I am okay. I did not leap off the cliff out of some weird parallel allegory.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought it was because your Logan's Run crystal started flashing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's it. I just thought it was going to be cool as shit, and then it wasn't.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, and then it was absolutely was cool as shit. What are you talking about? That's the kind of shit that makes D&D. Are you kidding me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you'd know if it's a cry for help.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The finish, though, the landing--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should have stuck the landing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone would have remembered a goldfish's entry into the ocean for five minutes. Everyone is going to remember Keyleth splattering across the rocks forever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That goldfish wouldn't have remembered it very long either.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've got this great trick, but I can only do it once.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In my head, I was an awesome cartoon, and it worked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it would have, but it got down to the dice. As always, if I rolled lower than 50%, it would have been fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 100d6 dice, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, guys. Have a good night, a good weekend, rest well, and we'll see you guys next week, and is it Thursday yet? Good night!
